gt object as RTF — as_rtf" />

Output a gt object as RTF

Source: R/as_rtf.R
as_rtf.Rd

Get the RTF content from a gt_tbl object as as a single-element character vector. This object can be used with writeLines() to generate a valid .rtf file that can be opened by RTF readers.

as_rtf(data)

Arguments

data

a table object that is created using the gt() function.

See also

Other table export functions: as_latex, as_raw_html, extract_summary

Examples

# Use `gtcars` to create a gt table;
# add a header and then export as
# RTF code
tab_rtf <-
  gtcars %>%
  dplyr::select(mfr, model) %>%
  dplyr::slice(1:2) %>%
  gt() %>%
  tab_header(
    title = md("Data listing from **gtcars**"),
    subtitle = md("`gtcars` is an R dataset")
  ) %>%
  as_rtf()

# `tab_rtf` is a single element character
# vector
tab_rtf %>% cat()
#> {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf1561\cocoasubrtf400
#> {\fonttbl\f0\fswiss\fcharset0 Helvetica;}
#> {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;
#> }
#> {\*\expandedcolortbl;;\cssrgb\c0\c0\c0;\cssrgb\c37036\c37036\c37036;\csgray\c0\c0;
#> }
#> \deftab20
#> \cf0
#> \itap1\trowd \taflags1 \trgaph108\trleft-108 \trbrdrt\brdrnil \trbrdrl\brdrnil \trbrdrr\brdrnil
